instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00281: What is 820-00281? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.ISL9239: What is ISL9239? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2016-2018 responsible for charging the battery and creating the power rail PPBUS_G3H.
definitions.PP3V3_G3H: What is PP3V3_G3H? PP3V3_G3H is a 3.3v power line that is present when the machine is in a Global System Hardware Off state, and should come on before most other rails so that the USB-C circuitry can be powered for the charger.
definitions.PM_EN_P3V3_G3H: What is PM_EN_P3V3_G3H? PM_EN_P3V3_G3H is a signal that enables the PP3V3_G3H rail to turn on. This comes out of ISL9239 or ISL9240 chip; when missing, often is missing because of a bad ISL9239 or ISL9240 chip. .
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.R7020: What is R7020? Current sense shunt resistor for the charger, the resistors between this and the ISL6259 should be proper rating or else machine will turn off the charger. Measuring pins 27/28 on ISL6259 should give you 20.02 ohms. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - stuck at 5V not turn on
threads.message: Hi, I have this board here and <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> is 0,0V and <SIGNAL>PM_EN_P3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> is also 0,0V. Charger stuck at 5V and 32mA. Sometimes when board is lying around it switches to 20v also 32mA. But if you plug in plug out and so on normally getting only 5V. <CHIP>ISL9239</CHIP> is getting 5volts but no output on <SIGNAL>PM_EN_P3V3_G3H</SIGNAL>. Can we say that 100% the <CHIP>ISL9239</CHIP> is bad, or is there also an enable signal for the <CHIP>ISL9239</CHIP>? No short found on <SIGNAL>PM_EN_P3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H</SIGNAL>

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - stuck at 5V not turn on
threads.message:
If USB-C meter switches sometime to 20V, that means SMC and <CHIP>ISL9239</CHIP> work in that moment (at least partially).
You may have bad solders, or intermitent contacts on some trace.

Check <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> basic voltages; <SIGNAL>P_IN</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>AUX_DET</SIGNAL>, VDDA/P, <SIGNAL>SMC_RST_IN</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>EN_VR1</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>SMC_RST</SIGNAL>*, <SIGNAL>AUX_OK</SIGNAL>, A/BMON.
All USB-C ports have the same behavior?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - stuck at 5V not turn on
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>P_IN</SIGNAL> = 5,0V on Pin 3 <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR>
<SIGNAL>AUX_DET</SIGNAL> = 1,265V on Pin 1 <RESISTOR>R7016</RESISTOR>
VDDA = 2,63V on Pin 1 <CAPACITOR>C7075</CAPACITOR>
VDDP = 2,63 on Pin 1 <CAPACITOR>C7077</CAPACITOR>
<SIGNAL>SMC_RST_IN</SIGNAL> = 0,0V on Pin 4 <CHIP>U5256</CHIP>
<SIGNAL>EN_VR1</SIGNAL> = 0,0V on Pin 1 <RESISTOR>R6921</RESISTOR>
<SIGNAL>SMC_RST</SIGNAL>* = 0,0V on Pin 1 <RESISTOR>R7090</RESISTOR>
<SIGNAL>AUX_OK</SIGNAL> = 0,0V on Pin 2 <TRANSISTOR>Q5490</TRANSISTOR>
AMON = 0,0V on Pin 1 <RESISTOR>R5439</RESISTOR>
BMON = 0,0V on Pin 1 <RESISTOR>R5429</RESISTOR>

All usb Ports have same behavior also with known good usb connector. Board was lying around for 1 hour first plug in switch to 20v, plug out plug in only 5v

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - stuck at 5V not turn on
threads.message:
"VDDA = 2,63V on Pin 1 <CAPACITOR>C7075</CAPACITOR>
VDDP = 2,63 on Pin 1 <CAPACITOR>C7077</CAPACITOR>"
Change <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>; you can try a reflow first.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00281</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - stuck at 5V not turn on
threads.message: So I have reballed the <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> and the macbook is working now. Thank you
